item.title: Pentagram brings Mastercard into digital age with logo redesign
item.description:
Pentagram brings Mastercard into digital age with logo redesign

Design agency Pentagram has created a new logo and visual identity for Mastercard, the credit card company's first branding redesign in 20 years. The new design retains the two overlapping red and yellow circles, but swaps the stripes in the central portion for a block orange colour.

item.title: Vajrasana retreat centre review - magnificent, modern Buddhist haven
item.description:
Vajrasana retreat centre review - magnificent, modern Buddhist haven

"My name is Maitrivajri," says the lady waiting at the entrance to a smart black barn, deep in the Suffolk countryside. "It means a diamond thunderbolt of universal loving kindness." It's not quite what you expect to encounter on the edge of the sleepy village of Walsham-le-Willows, but then this is no ordinary barn.

item.title: JI-SHI Urban Harvest / Atelier I-N-D-J
item.description:
JI-SHI Urban Harvest / Atelier I-N-D-J

The restaurant sits in the outskirts of Shanghai in the newly formed Disney town, with views from within over a large lake. Occupying a concrete framed building the design seeks to occupy this banal framework; exposing slabs, columns and ductwork whilst shrouding the honest backdrop in certain areas with planes of plaster and ply.

item.title: Dutch Artist's Sculpture Offers a Splash From Thin Air
item.description:
Dutch Artist's Sculpture Offers a Splash From Thin Air

SCHEVENINGEN, the Netherlands - Every once in a while - and usually just when people have stopped paying attention - an unassuming red cedarwood sculpture in the courtyard of the Beelden aan Zee museum here ejects a stream of water, spraying across the patio.

item.title: Architects Seize on Potential in China's Countryside
item.description:
Architects Seize on Potential in China's Countryside

LING'AN, China - Nestled in verdant hills amid bamboo forests and feathery grass meadows, the Sun Commune is a thriving eco-farm about 60 miles from the eastern Chinese city of Hangzhou. Its centerpiece is a pig barn. Yet this home for 30 or so black hogs is no ordinary outbuilding.

item.title: Antony Gormley: Humans are building 'a vast termites' nest' of greed
item.description:
Antony Gormley: Humans are building 'a vast termites' nest' of greed

Antony Gormley says his first White Cube exhibition in four years, which opens in September, is driven by "more of a sense of urgency" than any other show he has done.

item.title: Alexander Calder, 'Gamble', 1973, Partners & Mucciaccia | Artsy
item.description:
Alexander Calder, 'Gamble', 1973, Partners & Mucciaccia | Artsy

American artist Alexander Calder changed the course of modern art by developing an innovative method of sculpting, bending, and twisting wire to create three-dimensional "drawings in space."

item.title: Laura Craig McNellis, 'Untitled (No. 17)', 1972-1980, Ricco/Maresca Gallery | Artsy
item.description:
Laura Craig McNellis, 'Untitled (No. 17)', 1972-1980, Ricco/Maresca Gallery | Artsy

Ricco/Maresca champions and showcases the art of self-taught masters working outside the art-historical mainstream. The gallery focuses on significant contemporary art in various media, crossover artists and historically important American work of the 20th century.

item.title: Alexander Calder, 'Luck', 1973, Partners & Mucciaccia | Artsy
item.description:
Alexander Calder, 'Luck', 1973, Partners & Mucciaccia | Artsy

American artist Alexander Calder changed the course of modern art by developing an innovative method of sculpting, bending, and twisting wire to create three-dimensional "drawings in space."

item.description:

American artist Alexander Calder changed the course of modern art by developing an innovative method of sculpting, bending, and twisting wire to create three-dimensional "drawings in space."
